title: Bukit Bayu a perfect blend of nature and luxury [WATCH]
summary: Situated in the heart of nature, Bukit Bayu in U10 is a luxury property that stands out as a tranquil retreat where lush greenery blends with a close-knit community.Developed by Kimlun Land Sdn Bhd, the exclusive property com- prises ...
content:
Situated in the heart of nature, Bukit Bayu in U10 is a luxury property that stands out as a tranquil retreat where lush greenery blends with a close-knit community.

Developed by Kimlun Land Sdn Bhd, the exclusive property com- prises five phases.

An artist's impression of Bukit Bayu in U10, Shah Alam.

The company is finalising Phase 2A, which includes 16 units slated for completion by the end of next year.

title: The Week Ahead: FOMC meeting in focus, US Democratic presidential candidate could be announced
summary: The main focus this week will be the US Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) meeting on July 30 and 31.
content:
This article first appeared in The Edge Malaysia Weekly on July 29, 2024 - August 4, 2024

The main focus this week will be the US Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) meeting on July 30 and 31.

Although Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell signalled at end-2023 that interest rate cuts could happen in 2024, they have yet to occur.

title: A major win in Sarawak’s bid to reclaim rights
summary:
Sarawak certainly had more good reasons to celebrate its 61st year of independence last Monday (July 22).

In conjunction with the celebration, the state saw the inauguration of a new methanol plant in Bintulu and the signing of gas sales agreements — the first after state-owned Petroleum Sarawak Bhd (Petros) became the sole gas aggregator, taking over from Petroliam Nasional Bhd (Petronas).
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (July 27): Sarawak certainly had more good reasons to celebrate its 61st year of independence last Monday (July 22).

In conjunction with the celebration, the state saw the inauguration of a new methanol plant in Bintulu and the signing of gas sales agreements — the first after state-owned Petroleum Sarawak Bhd (Petros) became the sole gas aggregator, taking over from Petroliam Nasional Bhd (Petronas).

title: Under pressure in China, Mercedes trims 2024 car profit outlook
summary: Mercedes-Benz on Friday narrowed its annual profit margin forecast for its core car division as the German luxury automaker faces fierce competition in China, though new models should lift sales in the second half of the year.The company said ...
content:
Mercedes-Benz on Friday narrowed its annual profit margin forecast for its core car division as the German luxury automaker faces fierce competition in China, though new models should lift sales in the second half of the year.

The company said it now expected an adjusted return on sales in the range of 10-11% this year, down from its previous target range of 10-12%.

Mercedes' cars division achieved a 10.2% return on sales in the second quarter, while its adjusted earnings came in below analyst expectations.

title: Wall St Week Ahead: Investors brace for tech earnings
summary: Rattled investors are bracing for earnings from the market’s biggest tech companies, a Federal Reserve policy meeting and closely watched employment data in a week that could determine the near-term trajectory of US stocks following a bout of severe turbulence.
content:

title: Oil ends week lower on China demand fears
summary: Oil futures fell about 1.5% on Friday, finishing the week lower on declining Chinese demand and hopes of a Gaza ceasefire agreement that could ease Middle East tensions and accompanying supply concerns.
content:
Brent crude settled down US$1.24, or 1.5%, at US$81.13 a barrel. West Texas Intermediate crude ended US$1.12, or 1.4%, lower at US$77.16 a barrel.

HOUSTON: Oil futures fell about 1.5% on Friday, finishing the week lower on declining Chinese demand and hopes of a Gaza ceasefire agreement that could ease Middle East tensions and accompanying supply concerns.

title: Wall St settles higher on inflation data, tech stocks
summary: Wall Street's major indices ended higher on Friday as investors flocked back to tech megacaps that had triggered broad sell-offs earlier in the week, and inflation data boosted optimism that the Federal Reserve will soon commence cutting interest rates.
content:
The S&P 500 gained 59.88 points, or 1.11%, at 5,459.10 points, while the Nasdaq climbed 176.16 points, or 1.03%, to 17,357.88. The Dow rose 654.27 points, or 1.64%, to 40,589.34. — Reuters

title: Premier: Sarawak expects to ink S&P on Affin Bank deal in a month
summary:
SARAWAK expects to formalise a deal to raise its stake in Affin Bank Bhd to about 30% in about a month, according to the state’s premier Tan Sri Abang Johari Openg.

In an exclusive interview with The Edge in Kuala Lumpur last Friday (July 19), Abang Johari said the state is committed to...
content:
This article first appeared in The Edge Malaysia Weekly on July 22, 2024 - July 28, 2024

SARAWAK expects to formalise a deal to raise its stake in Affin Bank Bhd to about 30% in about a month, according to the state’s premier Tan Sri Abang Johari Openg.

title: ESG reporting standards must be elevated
summary: The environmental, social, and governance (ESG) criteria are a set of standards used to evaluate a company’s operations and performance in certain key areas.
content:
Agriculturist and paraplegic Dr Billy Tang.

THE environmental, social, and governance (ESG) criteria are a set of standards used to evaluate a company’s operations and performance in certain key areas.

These standards have become crucial for promoting sustainable and responsible business practices.

title: Picking up speed
summary: MALAYSIA has made significant progress in its fifth-generation (5G) mobile network development since the technology’s initial rollout in the country in 2021.
content:
Malaysia’s 5G network is poised to become a critical component in the country’s technological advancement and economic growth. — Bloomberg

title: Fed may be two meetings away from policy mistake
summary: The US inflation rate, which had surged to over 9% two years ago, is now around 3%. Based on current trends, it should settle at 2.5% to 3%, a range that most economists would deem consistent with financial stability, including a firm anchoring of inflationary expectations.
content:
Playing it safe: People ride scooters past the Federal Reserve building in Washington DC. Part of its hesitancy to cut rates is its lack of confidence that inflation will continue to decline to the 2% target rather than just settle at a stable 2.5% to 3%. — Bloomberg

title: Can Hong Kong make stablecoins safer?
summary: In less than 18 months, global banks will have to confront a problem almost philosophical in its scope, but with practical cost implications: What is money, and who can say when something is or isn’t? Hong Kong hopes to get the job of helping make that distinction.
content:
Regulators would rather be cautious than sorry. — Bloomberg

IN less than 18 months, global banks will have to confront a problem almost philosophical in its scope, but with practical cost implications: What is money, and who can say when something is or isn’t? Hong Kong hopes to get the job of helping make that distinction.

title: China to resort to consumer stimulus
summary: China's use of ultra-long treasury bonds to fund a consumer goods trade-in programme deviates from the usual playbook of boosting investment to support the economy and is fuelling expectations for more stimulus that targets household demand.
content:

title: Do ESG scores boost valuation?
summary: As Malaysia moves ahead in adopting best practices with respect to environmental, social, and governance (ESG) issues, companies listed on the Main Market of Bursa Malaysia are now required to disclose sustainability matters.
content:
Using an ESG score of a company to determine the valuation of a company is seen as flawed and must be avoided at all costs.

AS Malaysia moves ahead in adopting best practices with respect to environmental, social, and governance (ESG) issues, companies listed on the Main Market of Bursa Malaysia are now required to disclose sustainability matters.

title: Finding the right chemistry
summary: When talking to Lee Cheun Wei about Ancom Nylex Bhd, one would think he is a chemist. But he is very much a numbers person, an accountant by training.
content:
Ancom Nylex Bhd MD/CEO Lee Cheun Wei.

WHEN talking to Lee Cheun Wei about Ancom Nylex Bhd, one would think he is a chemist. But he is very much a numbers person, an accountant by training.
